text: Suppose one cell of the nitrogen fixer Sinorhizobium meliloti colonizes a plant root.

Suppose further that the sum total of subsequent bacterial replication and death (caused by the host) produces an average generation time of 2 hours and you will feel sick when there are 1,000,000 bacteria.

After 5 days (120 hours), there the bacterial doubling time? 

The mathematics of exponential growth is relatively straightforward, but remember that microbes grow differently in pure culture (very rare in nature) than they do in mixed communities, where neighboring cells produce all kinds of substances that may feed or poison other microbes.

In mixed communities, the microbes may grow planktonically (f loating in liquid), as in the open ocean, or as a biofilm on solid matter suspended in that replicate its chromosome and about 20 minutes to prepare for another round of replication.
They all survive the stomach and enter the intestine.
How might the cell overlap the two processes?
How much time will elapse before you feel sick?
4.9 Suppose you ingest 20 cells of Salmonella enterica in a peanut butter cookie.
